item.title: Database Transactions
item.description: üîç Database transactions are key to SQL operations. They allow multiple actions‚Äîlike reading, updating, and deleting data‚Äîto be performed as a single unit. In SQL, transactions start with BEGIN; and end with COMMIT;. If issues arise, you can use ROLLBACK; to revert changes. This ensures data integrity, even in unexpected situations like power outages. ‚ö° Both MySQL and Postgres manage these transactions differently, with Postgres using multi-versioning and MySQL employing an undo log to…
